intro: Conyza bustillosiana, commonly known as the Mexican fleabane, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer months. Conyza bustillosiana is also known for its ability to thrive in poor soils and its potential medicinal uses in traditional medicine.
